result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles C. Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles C. Goodwin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles C. Goodwin was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain mental and physical health needs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles C. Goodwin

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed; the enhancer in ct 1 of possession of a controlled substance on or near certain places is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample; pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 6/10/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Andrea Rufo. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Judicial pretrial on 4-8-15 @ 8:45am. Bond continued.
